channel.title: CVE Feed for Qualcomm, Inc. -- All Qualcomm products
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Qualcomm, Inc. -- All Qualcomm products

item.title: CVE-2016-10382|2024-09-16T19:14:45.630Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, access control to the I2C bus is not sufficient.

item.title: CVE-2015-9062|2024-09-16T17:27:43.818Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an integer overflow to buffer overflow vulnerability exists when loading an ELF file.

item.title: CVE-2016-5853|2024-09-16T18:38:18.773Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In an audio driver in all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, when a sanity check encounters a length value not in the correct range, an error message is printed, but code execution continues in the same way as for a correct length value.

item.title: CVE-2016-5871|2024-09-16T17:04:08.260Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an integer overflow to buffer overflow vulnerability exists when loading an image file.

item.title: CVE-2016-5863|2024-09-16T19:40:20.392Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In an ioctl handler in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android, several sanity checks are missing which can lead to out-of-bounds accesses.

item.title: CVE-2015-9049|2024-09-16T16:18:46.443Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in the processing of certain responses from the USIM.

item.title: CVE-2017-9682|2024-09-16T19:01:33.973Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition in two KGSL driver functions can lead to a Use After Free condition.

item.title: CVE-2015-9040|2024-09-16T19:20:54.286Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in a GERAN API.

item.title: CVE-2015-9061|2024-09-16T18:34:50.927Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, playReady DRM failed to check a length potentially leading to unauthorized access to secure memory.

item.title: CVE-2017-8261|2024-09-16T18:03:01.370Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, in a camera driver ioctl, a kernel overwrite can potentially occur.

item.title: CVE-2016-10344|2024-09-16T18:29:28.139Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, the use of an out-of-range pointer offset is potentially possible in LTE.

item.title: CVE-2016-10383|2024-09-16T18:38:22.005Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, there is a TOCTOU race condition in Secure UI.

item.title: CVE-2015-9051|2024-09-16T18:38:25.617Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in LTE where an assertion can be reached due to an improper bound on a length in a System Information message.

item.title: CVE-2017-9679|2024-09-16T18:23:24.252Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, if a userspace string is not NULL-terminated, kernel memory contents can leak to system logs.

item.title: CVE-2015-9055|2024-09-16T18:34:29.213Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an assertion was potentially reachable in a memory management routine.

item.title: CVE-2015-9047|2024-09-16T16:33:45.871Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in GNSS when performing a scan after bootup.

item.title: CVE-2015-9046|2024-09-16T17:32:57.106Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in LTE where an assertion can be reached due to an improper bound on the size of a frequency list.

item.title: CVE-2017-9684|2024-09-16T18:29:29.646Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition in a USB driver can lead to a Use After Free condition.

item.title: CVE-2015-9060|2024-09-16T19:04:55.600Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a pointer is not properly validated in a QTEE system call.

item.title: CVE-2017-8259|2024-09-16T16:32:39.999Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In the service locator in all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow can occur as the variable set for determining the size of the buffer is not used to indicate the size of the buffer.

item.title: CVE-2016-5855|2024-09-16T18:29:34.591Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In a driver in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android, a user-supplied buffer is casted to a structure without checking if the source buffer is large enough.

item.title: CVE-2015-9037|2024-09-16T19:00:47.341Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer over-read may occur in the processing of a downlink 3G NAS message.

item.title: CVE-2015-9048|2024-09-16T19:40:45.913Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a vulnerability exists in the processing of lost RTP packets.

item.title: CVE-2015-9068|2024-09-16T16:22:43.305Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an argument to a mink syscall is not properly validated.

item.title: CVE-2017-8253|2024-09-16T17:15:16.073Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, kernel memory can potentially be overwritten if an invalid master is sent from userspace.

item.title: CVE-2017-8260|2024-09-16T19:30:58.797Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, due to a type downcast, a value may improperly pass validation and cause an out of bounds write later.

item.title: CVE-2014-9979|2024-09-16T18:43:26.239Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a variable is uninitialized in a TrustZone system call potentially leading to the compromise of secure memory.

item.title: CVE-2015-8592|2024-09-16T16:48:54.071Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a pointer is not validated prior to being dereferenced potentially resulting in Guest-OS memory corruption.

item.title: CVE-2017-9678|2024-09-16T18:56:22.248Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, in a video driver, memory corruption can potentially occur due to lack of bounds checking in a memcpy().

item.title: CVE-2015-9072|2024-09-16T18:48:55.111Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an untrusted pointer dereference can occur in a TrustZone syscall.
